FuncDef:
The port-forwarding address-group command enables a device to dynamically associate a port range in a DS-Lite address pool with internal hosts.
The undo port-forwarding address-group command disables a device from dynamically associating a port range in a DS-Lite address pool with internal hosts.
By default, no port range in a DS-Lite address pool is configured or associated with internal hosts.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a DS-Lite address pool.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies an end port number to be reserved. The end port number cannot be less than the start port number.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 65535. The end port number must be greater than or equal to the start port number.

Specifies a start port number to be reserved.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 65535.

ExtraInfo:
The IP addresses of internal hosts may frequently change. To prevent frequent manual modification of DS-Lite configurations, configure the port forwarding function to dynamically associate each internal host with a public IP address and port.
To configure a DS-Lite address and a port range that can be dynamically associated with an internal host, run the port-forwarding address-group command. After the configuration, the ports in the specified range cannot be used as public ports in DS-Lite translation.
